quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Body and Internet
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, lol, abbreviation. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: http://www.123facts.com/ is referred to as this.
One of these things will not help you to get in touch with your neighbours PC.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cache server

questions.question: The terms smiley and emoticon refer to one and the same thing.
In chat jargon, the emoticon  [8-] refers to this person.
The term arthro is of Greek origin. It refers to which part of the body?
Erythrocytes are a type of blood cells, consisting mainly of hemoglobin. What does the word erythro mean?
The medical term cardio, deriving from a Greek word, refers to which organ of the human body?
The word hepato, which derives from Greek, refers to the kidney.
One of the following pairs (chat abbreviation - its  meaning) is wrong.

options.text: TTYL - To Tell You a Lie

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: TTYL - To Tell You a Lie

questions.question: If you and I are chatting over the Internet and I write LOL, that means that I am doing this.
The word adeno, deriving from Greek, refers to which to what body part?
An icon or animation to represent a participant used in Internet chat and games is referred to as this.
If they call me a newbie then I am new to the Internet; and/or new to the subject in general.
Gastro is a common medical prefix, derived from the Greek word gastros which means what?
The term thrombo, which comes from Greek, refers to a blood clot.

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Loss and Death
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, brain, dessert. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This progressive generative disease of the brain results in loss of cognitive ability and uncontrolled movements, called chorea, the Greek word for dance.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Huntingtons Disease

questions.question: In the USA, the color of the plastic tags, used to seal bread bags, indicates on what day the loaves were baked.
Chop Suey, a pasta dish consisting of short noodles, was originally made and served in which country?
Death of heart tissues due to loss of blood supply correctly describes the condition known as Myocardial Infarction.
What food results in negative calories when eaten?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Onco, coming from the Greek word onkos refers to what?
The food colorants, cochineal and carmine, are made from what?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A kind of insect

questions.question: The traditional Japanese dish, sushi, is always made with raw fish.
In 2003, the FDA issued a warning about a possible connection between green onions and which disease?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hepatitis A

questions.question: Gatorade, a non-carbonated sports drink, was invented by researchers at the University of Florida and named in honor of the Florida Gators, the schools football team.
Which of these statements, related to the effects of eating turkey, is true?

options.text: Turkey slows your metabolic rate which makes you drowsy
A turkey makes you sleepy as it contains the natural sedative L-tryptophan
Increased blood flow to the gastrointestinal tract makes one drowsy

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: None of these

questions.question: Twinkies, the sponge cake with creamy filling, created by Hostess, have an indefinite shelf life.
Which of these is best describes the cause of Parkinsons disease?

options.text: Changes in the myelin sheath of the neuron
Decreased blood flow to the brain

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A decrease in a neurotransmitter

questions.question: Jell-O, the popular gelatin dessert, is made in part, from what?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bones and hides

questions.question: The two terms nephro and ren both refer to the kidneys.

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Marijuana and Physician
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, condition, opium. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Marijuana is produced from parts of the male cannabis plants.
If your physician tells you that you have Presbycusis due to the normal process of aging, he may suggest that you need which of these?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hearing aid

questions.question: With the passage of the Marijuana Tax Act, the United States effectively banned recreational and medicinal use of cannabis. What year was this act adopted?
Which side effect is not related to the use of marijuana?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Violent behaviour

questions.question: Which of these most accurately describes the medical term, necrosis?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Death of living tissue

questions.question: In the US, what was the average street cost of a lid (3/4 ounce bag) of marijuana in the mid 1970s?
According to anonymous researches, conducted in the USA in 2002, most teenagers aged 12-17 have at least tried Marijuana.
If you have hyperthyroidism, your body is overproducing what hormone?
Marijuana is known by many names, including all of these but one. Which is the odd name?
Does the condition known as Hypoglycemia imply that blood sugar levels in the body are too high?
What is marijuanas primary active ingredient?
How many different chemicals can be found in marijuana?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: More than 400

questions.question: Your physician has ordered an electroencephalogram (EEG), the graphic recording of the electrical activity of what organ?
By amending its Opium Act in 1976, the government of which country decided to treat possession of up to 30 grams of marijuana as an activity not for prosecution, detection or arrest?
Which of these medical terms means difficulty in swallowing.

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Disorder and Condition
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, condition, john. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The term blepharo derives from a Greek word and refers to which part of the body?
This disorder is the abnormal accumulation of cerebrospinal fluid in the ventricles of the brain.
What US state enacted Proposition 215, the Compassionate Use Act, which allowed sick and dying patients to legally use marijuana for medicinal purposes?
Carcino is a word of Greek origin which refers to the small intestines.
The presence of gallstones in the gallbladder is defined by what medical term?
The sphygmomanometer is a device invented by Samuel Siegfried Karl Ritter von Basch, used to measure what?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Blood pressure

questions.question: Pre-eclampsia, thought to be caused by inflammatory mediators, is a medical condition associated with which of these?
Arthralgia is a severe heart disorder.
Down Syndrome, named after Dr. John Langdon Down, is actually a chromosomal defect.
What medical term is synonym of jaundice, a condition characterized by yellowing of the skin, sclera and mucous membranes?
Tourette syndrome is a neurological disorder, characterized by tics -- involuntary, rapid, movements or vocalizations.
The term encephalon, defined as the brain of a vertebrate, derives from a Greek word which means what?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: In the head

questions.question: This is the colloquial equivalent of the medical term Herpes zoster, which is used to define a condition, caused by the varicella zoster virus.

This disorder, from a Greek word meaning failure to put in order, is characterised by lack of muscular coordination, and often occurs when parts of the nervous system which control movement are damaged.
An inguinal hernia occurs in the groin, the area between the abdomen and thigh.

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Memory and Body
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, oto, oophoro. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Scientists differentiate what three basic types of memory, based on the duration of memory retention?

options.text: Episodic memory, procedural memory, and semantic memory
Temporary memory, average memory, and permanent memory
Momentary memory, short-term memory, and permanent memory
Sensory memory, short-term memory, and long-term memory

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sensory memory, short-term memory, and long-term memory

questions.question: The prefix of Greek origin, oto is used in medical terminology to refer to what body part?
Déjà Vu is one of the curios brain phenomenon. Which of these most accurately describes the term?

options.text: A sensation of something seen or experienced before
A spontaneous involuntary creation of a false memory
A sudden flash of a long forgotten memory
The feeling that something familiar was never seen before

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A sensation of something seen or experienced before

questions.question: Which of these most accurately explains the controversial issue of  false memories?

options.text: Memories formed under the influence of misleading suggestions and clues
Memories lacking coherent and logical rationale

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Memories formed under the influence of misleading suggestions and clues

questions.question: Amnesia, the loss of significant amount of important information, is a memory impairment which happens as a result of which of these?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: The medical prefix bucco refers to which part of the head?
Typically, how many random items can human short-term memory store?
To which of these essential human abilities is memory closely related?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: The word phlebo is of Greek origin, which comes from the root phlein, meaning to gush or to overflow.  What part of the body does this word refer to?
Which of these medical terms refers to air passages in the lungs?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bronchial tubes

questions.question: Procedural Memory, a category of the long-term memory, refers to which of these basic human abilities?

options.text: The ability to gain and store general knowledge and information
The ability to consciously retrieve stored facts and information
The ability to acquire and develop skills

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The ability to acquire and develop skills

questions.question: Nearly everybody has experienced the tip-of-the-tongue situation when one is eagerly trying to think of a relatively familiar fact, name or word and is just about to recall it, but it constantly eludes him.  What is the explanation of this strange experience?

options.text: Unpleasant experience associated with the memory
Another item is blocking the recollection

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Another item is blocking the recollection

questions.question: The prefix neuro, which in Greek means sinew or string, is related to the nervous system.
The medical prefix oophoro, which derives from Greek, refers to which part of the body?
One of the most basic characteristics of our memory is the ability to forget, which is considered to be this type of function.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Adaptive function

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Plague and Pandemics
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, people, cure. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which Roman emperor died of Antonine plague? This plague was actually named after him.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Marcus Aurelius

questions.question: Is there a cure for the plague?
In the USA, obesity is the second leading cause of preventable death after this one.
When starting a diet you have to consume at least this number of calories per day, otherwise you will lose muscle.
This disease had 7 pandemics and is still causing epidemics.
During which war did the first known pandemic take place?  It dates back to 430 BC.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Peloponnesian War

questions.question: This terrible disease killed as much as 5% of the worlds population and affected almost 20% in just six months.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Spanish Flu

questions.question: Cancer is considered a pandemic.
In the study of memory, what does the term mnemonist refer to?

options.text: Individual who tends to create false memories
Individual who has recovered from amnesia

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Individual with exceptional memory

questions.question: This is one of the most common health problems that comes from being overweight.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: High blood pressure

questions.question: The smallpox isnt dangerous.
Which of these countries did cholera affect most?
At this stage of the plague, one of the the symptoms is the presence of black patches on the skin.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Septicemic Plague

questions.question: What is the main cause for most pandemics in history?

options.text: The bad hygiene of the people

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The domestication of animals

questions.question: How many people are overweight around the world?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: More than 1 billion
